Pre-Game Insights: West Indies lead the series 2-1 heading into the final two matches.
The 4th T20I starts at 10:30am on Saturday 12 August, with the 5th and final T20I match also starting at 10:30am on Sunday 13 August.
At least 15,000 spectators are expected to attend, traveling in from around the USA, the Caribbean and beyond.
A combined audience of over 200 million viewers will tune into the matches live on television and on their mobile devices.
West Indies Head Coach, Daren Sammy, expressed excitement about playing in Fort Lauderdale and emphasized the importance of putting on a good show for the fans.
Stacy Ritter, President and CEO of Visit Lauderdale, highlighted the pride in sponsoring the tournament and showcasing Broward County Stadium.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matches are hosted by Cricket West Indies and supported by Visit Lauderdale and the Florida Sports Foundation to grow awareness and participation in cricket in the USA.
The USA will host ICC 2024 T20I World Cup matches, making this event a great opportunity for Broward County Stadium to showcase its capabilities.
West Indies are led by captain Rovman Powell and include key players like Jason Holder and Nicholas Pooran.
India is led by Hardik Pandya and features world stars such as Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav.
